intro: Eriocaulon whangii, commonly known as the Whangarei flat sedge, is a low-growing perennial herb native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers in dense clusters. It typically grows in wetland or swampy areas, preferring moist, nutrient-poor soils. Eriocaulon whangii is an important component of New Zealand's freshwater ecosystems.
